name: Torna Fort (Prachandgad)
duration: 4–5 hours (one way, full ascent); 8–9 hours for full fort exploration
description: Torna, known as Prachandgad owing to its massive fortifications, is the highest hill fort in Pune district and was the first fort won by Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj at age 16. The trek is famed for rugged paths, stunning monsoon wildflower slopes, and breathtaking Sahyadri views. The ascent is long but scenic, passing ancient temples, bastions, and cisterns. The fort is known for strong winds, exposed ridges, and a sense of true wilderness.

startingPoint.name: Velhe Village
facilities: Basic tea stalls and snack shops
startingPoint.description: Velhe is the standard base village for Torna, situated about 50km from Pune city. The road is accessible year-round. Basic amenities available; start trek early to avoid sun and crowds.

networkAvailability.emergencyContact: 108 (ambulance), 112 (general emergency). Inform local guides before trek for safety.

waterSources: Carry at least 2–3 liters per person
foodOptions: No shops on trek or fort; carry packed lunch, energy snacks

recommendations: No permanent food/water stalls at summit

locations: Temple and flat areas on fort
facilities: Basic cave shelters for small groups
camping.cost: Free (own tent/sleeping gear required; arrange with villagers for tent rental)

permits.timings: Open from sunrise to sunset; night trekking and camping allowed with prior intimation to base villagers

commonRisks: Slippery and muddy trail during monsoon
Long, exposed ridges with strong winds
Dense fog reduces visibility in monsoon
precautions: Carry rain gear in wet season
rescuePoints: Base of Budhla Machi (popular plateau on fort)

monsoon.conditions: Heavy rain, high winds, clouds/fog, slippery paths, waterfalls along route
monsoon.recommendation: Trek only with experience, rain gear; breathtaking wildflowers but challenging conditions

winter.conditions: Cool, clear skies, excellent visibility, perfect for camping
winter.recommendation: Best season for trekking and fort camping

summer.conditions: Hot, exposed trail; carry extra water
summer.recommendation: Early morning trek advised; ample hydration is crucial

trekRoute.difficulty: Moderate–Difficult (long and steep sections, especially near fort walls)
